intro: Memaecylum, commonly known as the "scentless mayweed," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers and alternate, narrow leaves. The plants typically grow in dry, disturbed soils and are often found in grasslands and along roadsides. Memaecylum species are annual or biennial herbs with a taproot system. They are known for their ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and their role in supporting pollinator populations.
